column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Nsengimana (Rwanda): My delegation\r
#Text=welcomes this opportunity to participate in this open\r
#Text=debate on women and peace and security, and wishes to\r
#Text=express our appreciation to the delegation of the\r
#Text=People's Republic of China for convening it.
#Text=We also\r
#Text=thank the Secretary-General for his report (S/2008/622)\r
#Text=on women and peace and security, which offers an\r
#Text=assessment of the state of implementation of resolution\r
#Text=1325 (2000) and the challenges that remain.
#Text=I also would like to thank the Special Adviser to\r
#Text=the Secretary-General, Ms.
#Text=Rachel Mayanja; Under-\r
#Text=Secretary-General for Peacekeeping Operations,\r
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Alain Le Roy; the Executive Director of the United\r
#Text=Nations Development Fund for Women (UNIFEM),\r
#Text=Ms.
#Text=Ines Alberdi; and Ms.
#Text=Sarah Taylor, Coordinator of\r
#Text=the NGO Working Group on Women, Peace and\r
#Text=Security, for their fruitful and comprehensive\r
#Text=interventions on the present situation of women\r
#Text=regarding peace and security.
#Text=The genocide in Rwanda in 1994 witnessed some\r
#Text=of the most inhumane acts of violence targeted at\r
#Text=women and girls and the use of sexual violence as a\r
#Text=tactic of genocide.
#Text=The survivors of the genocide\r
#Text=continue to live with the consequences of those crimes\r
#Text=almost 15 years later.
#Text=The perpetrators of these heinous\r
#Text=crimes, the ex-forces armees rwandaises and\r
#Text=interahamwe, now the Forces democratiques de\r
#Text=liberation du Rwanda (FDLR), have been a main cause\r
#Text=of regional insecurity in the Great Lakes region since\r
#Text=1994 and continue to be a major factor in the current\r
#Text=situation in the eastern Democratic Republic of the\r
#Text=Congo.
#Text=The FDLR continues to commit war crimes,\r
#Text=crimes against humanity and numerous other human\r
#Text=rights violations in the Great Lakes region.
#Text=Many regional and international agreements and\r
#Text=instruments provide commendable mechanisms to deal\r
#Text=with the threat posed by FDLR, but little or no attempt\r
#Text=has been made to translate them into action.
#Text=It is\r
#Text=imperative that those agreements be put into action\r
#Text=promptly to enable a lasting solution to the problem,\r
#Text=which further threatens women in the Great Lakes\r
#Text=region.
#Text=The equal participation of women in the\r
#Text=promotion of peace and security in both conflict and\r
#Text=post-conflict situations is integral to any peacekeeping,\r
#Text=peacemaking or peacebuilding process.
#Text=It is in that\r
#Text=context that my Government has set out to ensure that\r
#Text=women are central to the political, economic and social\r
#Text=governance of our nation.
#Text=Women today hold 56 per\r
#Text=cent of seats in Parliament; head the Foreign,\r
#Text=Information and Education Ministries, among others;\r
#Text=head the police force and participate in peacekeeping\r
#Text=missions; and hold command positions in the armed\r
#Text=forces.
#Text=The participation of women in the maintenance\r
#Text=and promotion of peace can begin to manifest itself\r
#Text=only through sheer political will.
#Text=The Government of\r
#Text=Rwanda has made it abundantly clear that governance\r
#Text=without the participation of more than of half the\r
#Text=population is not governance.
#Text=Rwanda is a major troop-contributing country to\r
#Text=United Nations peacekeeping operations and has a\r
#Text=vested interest in preventing sexual violence in\r
#Text=situations of armed conflict.
#Text=Therefore, the Rwanda\r
#Text=Defence Forces (RDF) considers gender-based\r
#Text=violence and violence against women to be main\r
#Text=components of the security threat.
#Text=In that respect, the\r
#Text=gender desk at Rwanda Defence Headquarters devises\r
#Text=training programmes with the support of UNIFEM. to\r
#Text=raise awareness of gender-based violence and violence\r
#Text=against women in the armed forces.
#Text=Awareness of and training in how to respond to\r
#Text=gender-based violence and violence against women has\r
#Text=now been mainstreamed into the curriculum of all of\r
#Text=Rwanda's military schools and training institutions and\r
#Text=is integral to the preparation of all RDF battalions\r
#Text=preparing for peacekeeping missions abroad.
#Text=The\r
#Text=participation of Rwandan policewomen in\r
#Text=peacekeeping missions in the Sudan has further\r
#Text=ensured that they raise awareness among the\r
#Text=population in support of their missions.
#Text=We welcome the Secretary-General's report\r
#Text=calling for an increase in resources and support to\r
#Text=Governments in conflict or post-conflict situations to\r
#Text=ensure the increased participation of women in the\r
#Text=maintenance and promotion of peace.
#Text=We also look\r
#Text=forward to the establishment of a strengthened and\r
#Text=consolidated United Nations gender entity.
#Text=My Government therefore reiterates its support\r
#Text=for the continued implementation of Security Council\r
#Text=resolutions 1325 (2000) and 1820 (2008) and the\r
#Text=Protocol to the African Charter on Human and Peoples'\r
#Text=Rights on the Rights of Women in Africa and will\r
#Text=remain a strong advocate for the participation of\r
#Text=women in all aspects of governance.
